messageBody:
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Q: Is threading required to verify generating the event?
> Avoiding it would be better.

That's kind of what I was thinking but I was having a hard time figuring
out how to do it.

Thankyou Vladimir, Manuel, and J.B. I rewrote my test taking your
suggestions into account and my test is much more elegant now.

Here's what my test looks like after I rewrote it:

public void testEvents()
{
final DeviceDescriptor device = new
DeviceDescriptor(DeviceType.PRINTER, "Name", "Address");

class MockService extends AbstractDeviceListService
{
public MockService()
{
}
}

class MockListener implements DeviceListListener
{
public int addCount = 0;
public int removeCount = 0;

public void deviceAdded(DeviceListEvent event)
{
addCount += 1;
assertEquals(event.getDevice(), device);
}
public void deviceRemoved(DeviceListEvent event)
{
removeCount += 1;
assertEquals(event.getDevice(), device);
}
}

MockService service = new MockService();
MockListener listener = new MockListener();

service.addDeviceListListener(listener);

service.addDevice(device);
assertEquals(listener.addCount, 1);

service.removeDevice(device, 0);
assertEquals(listener.removeCount, 1);
}

Kris
